Description: Bronze axe-head: with a convex cutting-edge, concave sides and two lugs. There are no flanges on the butt and the sides. The blade is quite thickly corroded. One of the lugs is broken and the cutting edge is chipped.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (129)
Condition: incomplete - haft missing, one lug broken away, chipped cutting-edge
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
